seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE system function

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE system function

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the specified table, ensuring that all of its indexes are consistent with the base table.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the specified table, ensuring that all of its indexes are consistent with the base table.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> function checks the specified table, ensuring that all of its indexes are consistent with the base table.

trans-unit.source: If the table and indexes are consistent, the method returns a SMALLINT with value 1. If the table and indexes are inconsistent, the function will throw an exception.

seg-source.mrk: If the table and indexes are consistent, the method returns a SMALLINT with value 1.
If the table and indexes are inconsistent, the function will throw an exception.

target.mrk: If the table and indexes are consistent, the method returns a SMALLINT with value 1.
If the table and indexes are inconsistent, the function will throw an exception.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on the tables in a database offline after you back it up. Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one. Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed (for example, if you experience hardware or operating system failure), because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database. See "Checking database consistency" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on the tables in a database offline after you back it up.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.

Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed (for example, if you experience hardware or operating system failure), because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database.
See "Checking database consistency" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on the tables in a database offline after you back it up.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.

Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed (for example, if you experience hardware or operating system failure), because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database.
See "Checking database consistency" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

trans-unit.source: SMALLINT SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128))

seg-source.mrk: SMALLINT SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128))

target.mrk: SMALLINT SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(IN SCHEMANAME VARCHAR(128), IN TABLENAME VARCHAR(128))

trans-unit.source: An error will occur if either SCHEMANAME or TABLENAME are null.

seg-source.mrk: An error will occur if either SCHEMANAME or TABLENAME are null.

target.mrk: An error will occur if either SCHEMANAME or TABLENAME are null.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this function by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this function by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this function by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

seg-source.mrk: Check a single table:

target.mrk: Check a single table:

seg-source.mrk: VALUES SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE('SALES', 'ORDERS');

target.mrk: VALUES SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE('SALES', 'ORDERS');

seg-source.mrk: Check all tables:

target.mrk: Check all tables:

trans-unit.source: SELECT schemaname, tablename, SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(schemaname, tablename) FROM sys.sysschemas s, sys.systables t WHERE s.schemaid = t.schemaid;

seg-source.mrk: SELECT schemaname, tablename, SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(schemaname, tablename) FROM sys.sysschemas s, sys.systables t WHERE s.schemaid = t.schemaid;

target.mrk: SELECT schemaname, tablename, SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE(schemaname, tablename) FROM sys.sysschemas s, sys.systables t WHERE s.schemaid = t.schemaid;
